name: Sonesta ES Suites Flagstaff

reviews.text: I stayed at the Residence Inn for two weeks on business travel. The rooms were clean, grounds well maintained, and continental breakfast was good with many options. Have a kitchen was quite nice for a long stay. The location is not near downtown Flagstaff but is close to major highways. The area around the hotel is nice and I went out on a run on several occasions with no problems or concerns.
reviews.title: Good hotel for families or business traveler

reviews.text: In May, 2009, my wife and I went to Flagstaff Arizona for our daughter’s graduation from Northern Arizona University. We decided to stay at the Residence Inn because we thought that having a kitchen and sitting room might be useful during our stay. At $250 per night the cost was significantly more than other hotels we might have chosen. But as a long time Marriott customer I have stayed at many Residence Inn’s over the years and have always been satisfied and therefore willing to pay the higher price.
reviews.title: Motel 6 Quality at Marriott Prices

reviews.text: We were very disappointed by many aspects of our stay at the Flagstaff Residence Inn. The overall appearance of the facility is quite shabby and not up to Marriott standards. The two-room suite was cramped. A pod of 4 loud a/c units outside of the bedroom interrupted my sleep numerous times. Our second-story window was at the same level as the rural highway, producing lots of additional road noise.
reviews.title: A comfortable home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My guess is that that the proximity of this property to the Grand Canyon results in the "Disneyland Effect." This is the phenomenon where high demand on hotels near major attractions permits them to remain profitable with worn out facilities that offer poor service.
reviews.title: Clean but needs updating; very nice staff

reviews.text: I felt pretty stupid when I paid the $900 bill.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for 3 nights in the middle of April 2008. The hotel is located on the east side of Flagstaff right off I40. Very easy access to and from I40. There is a Safeway grocery store and the Flagstaff Mall about 1 mile away. It is about 15 miles from Sunset Crater. The Flagstaff Visitor Center is about 5 miles west in downtown Old Flagstaff.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay for Grand Canyon Visit

likes.disliked: — A little dated, needed some maintenance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilties are typical Residence Inn with kitchens but there are only Studio and 2 Bedroom suites, no 1-Bedroom suites. The faciltity is two-story with no elevators. The hotel is located in a quiet area. Parking spaces are located around the buildings near their entrances. The facilites are a little dated, paint peeling on the exterior, etc., but still better looking than most of the other motels along Business I40.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: There is the usual good free breakfast and the Monday through Thursday evening Manager's reception with food. Pets are permitted so sometimes you hear dogs barking but these are supposed to be in the East, pet-friendly wing. There is a coin-operated laundromat off the pool-patio area with four washers and dryers.
reviews.title: Nice stay

likes.liked: — Large two bedroom with full kitchen and free hot breakfast
likes.disliked: — The dog park because people did not pick up after thier animals we could not play in the snow there

reviews.text: There is a lot to see and do in the area compared to staying in or just south of the Grand Canyon. There are numerous fast food and other dining options in Flagstaff compared to the Park area.
reviews.title: This is a gem along a desolate stretch of I-40

likes.liked: — The natural surroundings and the area for pets

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of March, have to confirm the other reviews this is a great hotel. Checkin was very professional and welcoming. Our room was huge with an open fireplace, we heeded previous reviews and didn't light it though as the room heating was adequate. Full kitchen, televisions in both bedrooms and the lounge, very comfortable, easy access to the Interstate although a little out of the main part of Flagstaff. Good breakfast selections, with nicest scrambled eggs we have had at a hotel, everything fresh and replenished during serving time.
A nice place to spend the night. The building is a little old but the staff and service were excellent. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Comfortable and nice staff

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Residence Inn during the last week of March 2010. It was very roomy with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a living room/kitchen area. We were comfortable with the rooms. They do need some updating and one of the bathroom floors needs to be fixed (needs leveling and reflooring). The free big breakfasts were very good. Lots of food and lots to choose from. Remember to get the free firewood for a nice fire in the evening. The front desk was also very helpful. The location was excellent to visit downtown Flagstaff and to get to the routes to the Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: Good Value - Good Location.

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights. Everyone was friendly and nice and the rooms were clean. We stayed with family and friends and the staff were so accommodating and willing to help in any way. We will definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: I stayed here a week in November. The location is excellent - close to lots of National Parks/Monuments, and close to Sedona. You get a lot for your money. Super clean suite rooms. Full breakfast bar, with a delightful lady named Angel running the breakfast area. She is friendly and a pleasure to be around. On certain nights, this hotel has "happy hour" type events from 5 to 7pm with beer, wine and great little snacks. My stay here could not have been better and I would definitely return when in the area.
reviews.title: GREAT LONG-TERM PLACE TO STAY

reviews.text: I stayed at this establishment for two nights. I was traveling with my spouse and one other adult. When I booked the room, I assumed it would be comparable to other Marriott Residence Inns that I had stayed. It was rated as a level 5 hotel by the Marriott system and I have been a loyal Marriott customer so I assumed it would be a fairly nice hotel.
reviews.title: Big disappointment

reviews.text: I stayed at this property as part of a consulting project in the Flagstaff area that ran from mid-October to mid-December. Since my work often involves more lengthy stays, quality of lodging is very important to me.
reviews.title: An extended stay property that could use some help

reviews.text: As Marriott properties go, this facility was not among the best, though the location was pretty nice (across from a golf course, easy freeway access, quiet neighborhood). For the duration of my stay, I was in a second-floor room in Building 12, which was situated at the back end of their property.
reviews.title: Great space for family

reviews.text: None of the buildings have elevators, which surprised me. While I mostly didn't mind taking the stairs, it made hauling luggage, groceries, and so on more challenge than I wanted. Also, despite my room being non-smoking, I found the area immediately outside the door to be littered with cigarette butts. Often during the course of my stay, other guests would smoke in this common area rather than go downstairs to the designated area, so there were nights where the smoke smell was pretty overwhelming.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

likes.liked: — The location was great, very scenic.
likes.disliked: — The staff was inattentive to details. Under no circumstances should trash be outside of a room door. Lighting in the rooms should be checked on a regular basis.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the suite itself, the layout was a little odd, and aside from the tiny bathroom, there was no real separation between kitchen, living area, and bedroom. Lighting in the room was marginal. The furniture, appliances, and fixtures appeared worn. There were no dressers for clothes; there were only a few cube-type shelves in the closet. More days than not - regardless of the time of day - hot water was hard to come by; often for showers you would have to turn the water on and wait for upwards of 5 minutes. Mold and mildew was evident in the bathroom, and due to a semi-frequent sewer "burp", the toilet would have to remain closed so as to avoid having pungent smells wafting through the suite. Climate control in the room was also inconsistent; it was very difficult to maintain any consistency or stability in room temperature.
reviews.title: Superb - wished we were staying for longer!

likes.liked: — the room and concept is a great one
likes.disliked: — its a minor point - but finding it without directions would be hard

reviews.text: Internet access was also terrible; it would either be brutally slow, or would not be available at all. Also, there were times where I would have Internet Explorer open, and checking e-mail, and the access would be locked out for "overloading" the connection, requiring a call to the central IT support. Similarly, I often could not use my Rhapsody music player, as it could also cause a lockout.
reviews.title: Nasty Dirty Suite

description: Sonesta ES Suites Flagstaff is located off of historic Route 66 near the Lowell Observatory, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument and the Grand Canyon National Park. The hotel is convenient to many area businesses including Nestle Purina, WL Gore & Associates, and the Joy Cone Company. The hotel features oversized suites, a business center, high speed internet access, great room, meeting rooms, fitness center, seasonal swimming pool and whirlpool, outdoor recreational court, on-site laundry and same day dry-cleaning.
